--- In gladiator@y..., "oldschool518" <johnnyoldschool@e...> wrote:
> fairies should get an "bewitch" attack, or something, wherein an 
> enemy becomes all confused like and attacks everyone.

Hmm.
 
I'm in favor of druids being able to create faeries who have 1/6-1/4 
the experience level of the druid.

I also believe that a faerie's attacks should not be able to freeze 
any character for more than 5 minutes.  After the 5 minutes have 
expired, you would get 5 seconds of invunerability to the faerie 
attacks.  That would amount to about 1 second of invunerability to 
those attacks per minute frozen by the attack.  In the case of the 
mage/archmage, I'd use the 5 seconds either to use the heartburst 
attack to kill those annoying faeries or to teleport the heck away 
from faeries.

Frankly, I believe that the invulnerability potion should be able to 
block the effects of that attack, because it blocks the effects of 
every other attack.

I believe that faeries should be able to shoot out their attack in 
multiple directions.

About those druids, I have a question: can an exp level 10 druid 
create "stronger" trees than an exp level 1 druid?  Oh yea, druids 
should not be able to put more than 6-10 spells of protection around a 
character.
